intro: Kaukenia lacera, commonly known as the lacey kaukenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. Kaukenia lacera typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
